channel.title: Mom installs 98-inch screen in son's bedroom ceiling,
channel.description:
[img]http://www.blogcdn.com/www.engadget.com/media/2009/07/ceiling-screen-07-27-09.jpg[/img] Thought you had it all set with a 14-inch TV and an NES in your room as a kid? Then you might want to look away for a minute, lest your childhood memories be diminished. Everyone else can take a good look at this 98-inch screen that Patti Deni had installed flush in the ceiling of her son's bedroom. At the center of the setup is an NEC projector paired with some Draper projection mirrors, which fills that 98-inch StarGlas60 display with some full HD images than can be viewed from just about any angle. As you might expect, however, this wasn't exactly the easiest of installs, and apparently even involved reframing and reinforcing the ceiling. No word on any mom of the year awards just yet, but the setup itself has at least attracted the attention of Electronic House's Home of the Year awards.
Source: http://www.engadget.com/2009/07/27/mom-installs-98-inch-screen-in-sons-bedroom-ceiling-deservedly/

[quote=".Unlimited, post:34, topic:291390"][quote author=Full Metalst link=topic=385091.msg2892128#msg2892128 date=1248967247]
His wall is only like 150 inches :. Must’ve been hell to put it up there. Lots of “ugh” and “ahh” and “oh shit!”
[/quote]
Please refrain from posting.[/quote]
Don’t need to worry bout him no more. He is muted

Read full topic

[/quote]

I don’t really think a mom wants to know about it do you? I mean, everyone knows everyone does it, but you don’t want to think about your family doing it.

item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:24, topic:291390”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=385091.msg2890499#msg2890499 date=1248876585]

How could nobody of come up with this?
Get like 4 98" mirrors and mirror the huge TV horizontally so you can watch it normally.
It would take fuck loads space though.

or you could just mount it on some rails that folded it outwards into a horizontal position

Or save the hassle and mount it on a wall.

ya but who has 98" of free wall space
[/quote]
its also a rear projection setup, i doubt anyone has meter thick walls[/quote]

nono, it’s a projector that’s mirrored onto a piece of glass.

Read full topic
